title: Corso Garibaldi
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
Corso Garibaldi At the end of the twelfth century the town of Spoleto is raised after the city was destroyed by Barbarossa and expands beyond the walls of the ancient pre-Roman times, arriving to adopt a much broader boundary Suburb. Borghi are born and today the area between Piazza Garibaldi to the tower of oil is the Borgo par excellence. The main street of Borgo, animated of life, is Corso Garibaldi, walk through magnificent mansions and boutiques that take us up to reach the upper part of the city. 
Nobody has marked this note useful
